measure.CatchLine: Prohibits a city from requiring a property owner to pay for the removal of a tree from public property or repairs to a public sidewalk damaged by a tree on public property.
measure.MeasureSummary:
Digest: The Act bars a city from making a property owner pay to cut down a tree on public property or to fix a sidewalk for damage from such a tree. (Flesch Readability Score: 60.7). 
	Prohibits a city from requiring a property owner to pay for the removal of a tree from public property or repairs to a public sidewalk damaged by a tree on public property. 
	Takes effect on the 91st day following adjournment sine die.
measure.RelatingToFull: Relating to costs associated with trees on public property; and prescribing an effective date.
measure.RelatingTo: Relating to costs associated with trees on public property; prescribing an effective date.
measure.FiscalImpact: May have fiscal impact, but no statement yet issued
measure.RevenueImpact: May have revenue impact, but no statement yet issued

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
Referred to Emergency Management, General Government, and Veterans.
